channel.title: Comments on: Project 2
channel.description: Group Project Site for SEng466 at the University of Victoria

item.title: By: nital patel
item.dc:creator: nital patel
item.description: hi i try to interface sensor with quardrotor.i will use arduino nano and c++eclipse to programming it .i try to send a sensor signal from arduino to ARdrone.can you guide me how to open a serial port in c++ programming eclipse and recive that data.i m new for these please help me.
item.content:encoded:
hi
i try to interface sensor with quardrotor.i will use arduino nano and c++eclipse to programming it .i try to send a sensor signal from arduino to ARdrone.can you guide me how to open a serial port in c++ programming eclipse and recive that data.i m new for these please help me.

item.title: By: Garrett
item.dc:creator: Garrett
item.description: We used two Arduino Unos. One for the Quadcopter and one for the base station. :)
item.content:encoded: We used two Arduino Unos. One for the Quadcopter and one for the base station. ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Andrei
item.dc:creator: Andrei
item.description:
Hi,
In this project you used a single Arduino UNO board ? I'm asking this because I saw that in the list parts in "REMOTE STATION" you say that is needed a Arduino UNO, and then in "QUADCOPTER" you say again that is needed a Arduino UNO.
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

In this project you used a single Arduino UNO board ?
I’m asking this because I saw that in the list parts in “REMOTE STATION” you say that is needed a Arduino UNO, and then in “QUADCOPTER” you say again that is needed a Arduino UNO.

item.title: By: Rabin
item.dc:creator: Rabin
item.description: Lipo 7.4v 2000mAh Battery is this battery rechargeable? If not what are the option?
item.content:encoded:
Lipo 7.4v 2000mAh Battery
is this battery rechargeable? If not what are the option?

item.title: By: Garrett
item.dc:creator: Garrett
item.description: We used Mystery electronic speed controllers (ESCs). More details are here: /project-2/esc-calibration-programming/
item.content:encoded: We used Mystery electronic speed controllers (ESCs). More details are here: /project-2/esc-calibration-programming/

item.title: By: Joao
item.dc:creator: Joao
item.description: hi, nice project! i am doing a similar project as my final project for my degree in computer science and i have a question, how do you control the motors? do you connect them directly to the arduino our you have a board to control them? thanks
item.content:encoded:
hi,
nice project!
i am doing a similar project as my final project for my degree in computer science and i have a question, how do you control the motors? do you connect them directly to the arduino our you have a board to control them?
thanks
